review: Excellent system if you have a powerful router, smartphone and computer.  If not, it tends to lag and quit unexpectedly.I found that streaming online video from my computer to Chromecast, like Netflix and HBO Go, used so much bandwidth that it was hard to send signal to TV without freezing or having high quality display.  I do not want to watch a movie at 480 definition on an HDTV - it is not worth it.  Similarly, controlling the device from an iPhone lagged behind when pausing or rewinding with such a delay it was nearly impossible to do so; eventually I tended to not even bother with it.Unless you have a solid internet connection and strong router, or powerful smartphone, its not as easy and seamless as it looks.

review: If you have a tablet and a HDTV then this is a good buy.  The apps are few right now, but they are starting to grow.  It is a great way to make any regular tv into a "semi" smart tv.  It still has some growing to do before I would call it smart.  For instance I would love to stream game apps from my tablet to the tv with this.  I am confident though that Google will continue to build the portfolio of apps that will make this shine.

review: Great!  Used these to build out a cheap wi-fi home audio system: I connected a google chromecast in to a Panlong HDMI audio extractor (available on amazon) for each "zone", then the output from each went in to amplifier, and then amplifier output for each went to my in-ceiling speakers.  Worked like a charm, now I have wifi-controlled audio in every room at 1/10th the cost of Sonos :)Only downside is I had to buy a clunky app on Android to play my MP3s from my phone (3.99) and/or play music from my computer via the chrome browser and google play music.  Hopefully Android integration will get a bit better.
